flawed_nl_solution:
On 80 games, Daniel spend 80 games * $12/game = $<<80*12=690>>690.
The rest of the collection is 346 games - 80 games = <<346-80=266>>266 games.
50/100 of these games means 50/100 * 266 games = <<50/100*266=133>>133 games.
Daniel bought them for $7 each, so he had to spend 133 games * $7/game = $<<133*7=931>>931 on them.
The other 133 games were bought for $3 each, so they've cost him 133 games * $3/game = $<<133*3=399>>399.
On all games in total Daniel spent $690 + $931 + $399 = $<<690+931+399=2020>>2020.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 960, not 690. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
